txt.en: Collected a soft clothbound bat
Batted a villain ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Heburga demands that you play the brigand this time, while the children play Rohirrim
The children of Langhold are playing a violent game of Brigand-bashing, and have asked you to join them.
A rider approaches....
'No fair, you're too strong! This time, YOU have to play the brigand, and we will be the great Riders of Rohan. We are coming for you... watch yourself, vile ruffian!'
The children of Langhold are at the farm near the town.

'Have you ever played a game of \qBrigand-bashing\q? It's easy! This time, you get to be the Warrior of Rohan, and we're the brigands. You have to catch us, but I bet you're not fast enough!\n\n'Take this bat -- we made it ourselves for the game. It's made of leather, bound in cloth, so it won't hurt us. Not that you could catch us anyhow!'
Use the bat to whomp the \qbrigands\q at the farm.
You should talk to Heburga to see if she concedes.

'Adults in this town do not waste time with child-games, [placeholder]. If you wish to face brigands, it appears a small band of them have returned from exile to harass a local farm.\n\n'Instead of playing with our idle children, you could perhaps prove yourself useful by dealing with real enemies, eh?'
The children are now the Rohirrim, and you're the brigand.\n\nYou should let the children beat you up.
'Enough games. Come, let us head back into town.'
You should speak with the rider who hailed you.
Get the bat from Heburga
Use the bat to whomp the \qbrigands\q ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Heburga and see if she concedes
Appease the children by letting them play Rohirrim, and beat you into submission
Instance: A Game of Brigand-bashing
Talk to the rider who hailed you
